noun.description: Lead ore in the form of small grains.

adjective.description: Resembling or reminiscent of peas or peasemeal. Chiefly in "peasy whin" (see "whin".

origin: Late 18th century; earliest use found in William Pryce (d. 1790), surgeon, mineralogist, and antiquary. From peasy<br>mid 18th century. From pease + -y<br>1980s; earliest use found in Blue Jeans. Short for easy-peasy.
